titlestmt.titleproper: Register of the Alfred Kohlberg papers
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Pruda L. Lood

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using the Archivists' Toolkit 2017-08-30T11:00-0700

change.item: Revised to update encoding and add unitid.
PUBLIC "-//Stanford University::Hoover Institution Archives//TEXT (US::CSt-H::::Alfred Kohlberg Papers)//EN" "reg_409.sgm" converted from EAD 1.0 to 2002 by v1to02.cdl.xsl (2004-09-16).

physdesc.extent: 232 manuscript boxes, 5 card file boxes, 3 oversize boxes

did.abstract: Correspondence, memoirs and other writings, newsletters, clippings, printed matter, photographs, and sound recordings relating to communism in the United States, China, and other parts of Asia, and to anti-communist movements in the United States.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copies of some sound recordings in this collection are available for immediate access. To listen to other sound recordings or to view videos, films, or digital files during your visit, please contact the Archives at least two working days before your arrival. We will then advise you of the accessibility of the material you wish to see or hear. Please note that not all material is immediately accessible.

userestrict.head: Publication Rights
userestrict.p: For copyright status, please contact the Hoover Institution Archives.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: [Identification of item], Alfred Kohlberg papers, [Box no.], Hoover Institution Archives.

acqinfo.head: Acquisition Information
acqinfo.p: Acquired by the Hoover Institution Archives in 1961, with increments received in subsequent years.

accruals.head: Accruals
accruals.p: Materials may have been added to the collection since this finding aid was prepared. To determine if this has occurred, find the collection in Stanford University's online catalog at http://searchworks.stanford.edu/. Materials have been added to the collection if the number of boxes listed in the online catalog is larger than the number of boxes listed in this finding aid.

chronitem.event: Textile importer dealing in Nationalist Chinese goods
Member of Board, Institute of Pacific Relations
Chairman, American Jewish League Against Communism

scopecontent.head: Scope and Content of Collection
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, memoirs and other writings, newsletters, clippings, printed matter, photographs, and sound recordings relating to communism in the United States, China, and other parts of Asia, and to anti-communist movements in the United States.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Correspondence, newsletters, clippings, and printed matter, arranged alphabetically by name of subject or correspondent.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: Use copy reference number: 61002.3. A copy with better sound quality exists in the Commonwealth Club of California records, also available at the Hoover Institution Archives.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Kohlberg talks about what he considers immoral actions on the part of the U.S. government including [his words] a "hypocritical" Atlantic Charter, the Cairo Agreement, deaths in Poland, and events in China and Korea. He believes that China was the scene of the greatest catastrophes suffered since World War II, and also the greatest breach of morals by the U.S. The U.S., he says, is paying the price of its Machiavellian immoralities to China on the battleground in Korea.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Disc contains 6 "tracks" and a total of 24 dictated letters: Track 1 (10 letters); Track 2 (3 letters); Track 3 (6 letters); Track 4 (2 letters); Track 5 (1 letter); Track 6 (2 letters).
